oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-11-28 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 28, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ferlin Husky (host/performer), guest performer Bill Anderson, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ferlin Husky; Archie Campbell; Bill Anderson; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Jordanaires; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ferlin Husky -- Black Sheep (Ferlin Husky) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Grant Turner introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell) -- Ferlin Husky and Grant Turner introduce Bill Anderson -- Dead Or Alive (Bill Anderson) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Tommy Jackson -- Wake Up Susan (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner introduces Ferlin Husky -- In The Garden (Ferlin Husky, Jordanaires) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Chet Atkins -- Cherokee (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Selph, Jimmy; Husky, Ferlin; Anderson, Bill, 1937-
